article: That day I was later for school, so Mom offered me a  _  . I sat beside her in our car, daydreaming about my  _  . I'd be graduating from high school in a few months. I'd leave high school behind and do whatever I wanted. What  _  I do? Go to college? Or get a job in an office where I could  _  my way up? Mom interrupted my thoughts."Kassandra, do you  _  that?''She asked just as we were  _  the railroad tracks. She stopped the car on the other side and  pointed out  the window. "It looks like a child.''  Sure enough  ,I saw a small boy walking by himeself. The warning lights on the train tracks flashed  _  .The boy stayed where he was right in the middle of the  _  .The whistle sounded. There's no  _  that train can stop in time!The boy jumped up and down and  _  at the engineer. I took off running. My shoes flopped against my feet as I  _  , so I kicked them off. I ran faster. Stones crunched and flew under my  _  feet. The ground shook. God, let me get to him! The train was almost on top of him. I  _  the boy in my arms. Keep running! But something  _  me. I fell backward, away from the train. I pulled the boy with me onto safe ground. The train barreled past. The noise was  _  . The wheels were so close that I could have reached out and touched one. Once the train was out of  _  , I stood up. Mom ran up and hugged me. "Kassandra, I didn't think you were going to  _  it !'' I got ready for bed that night  _  looking forward to school the next day. I wanted to enjoy every moment in life.
